item.title: sq data wrangler
item.description: sq is a free/libre open-source data wrangling swiss-army knife to inspect, query, join, import, and export data. You could think of sq as jq for databases and documents, facilitating one-liners like: sq '@postgres_db | .actor | .first_name, .last_name | .[0:5]'
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: daisyUI
item.description: Best Tailwind Components Library - Free UI components for Tailwind CSS
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: gabrielpetersson/fast-grid: World's most performant DOM-based web table.
item.description: World's most performant DOM-based web table. Contribute to gabrielpetersson/fast-grid development by creating an account on GitHub.

item.title: json-flatten, now with format documentation
item.description: json-flatten, now with format documentation-- a fun little Python library for converting JSON data into a flat key-value format, suitable for inclusion in an HTML form or query string.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Anyquery - Use SQL for everything
item.description: Query anything with SQL, from your Chrome tabs to your Notion database
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Adventures building a spreadsheet engine in Python | James' Coffee Blog
item.description: Spreadsheets are a fascinating tool. With a spreadsheet, you can both store and structure data, and include formulas that run computations on the contents of a sheet. Every so often, I ask myself how a spreadsheet works. How do spreadsheets turn data and a list of formulas into a complete table of data? This week, I set out to build a spreadsheet engine in Python.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Udon:13 v.2 | The Mad Noodle
item.description: The Udon:13 v.2 by The Mad Noodle: Elevate your desk setup with this Bespoke Premium Mechanical Macro Keypad. Featuring 12 hot-swap key switches, a knurled aluminum push-button encoder knob. The 128x32px OLED display provides crucial information, while the RGB under-glow adds flair. All fully programmable using VIA or QMK firmware. Encased in crystal-clear acrylic, with 25-degree titled feet, it showcases its signature 'Bare PCB Aesthetic'. Compatible with PC, Mac, Linux, and even iPad.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Let Me Summarize That For You
item.description: A tool to generate summaries of text documents or web pages.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Home - The Summarist
item.description: The Summarist is a collection of high-quality nonfiction book summaries. Its goal is to allow you to get an idea of the contents of a book before you buy it, and to be used as a reference if you have already read it.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: PunyPress | Generate concise summaries of articles easily
item.description: PunyPress is the easiest way to generate summaries of articles you read online
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Tidyread - AI-Powered Customizable Information Digest
item.description: Automatically curate and summarize information from your own feeds, delivering a tidy digest at a specified time for you. Start for free.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Midday | Run your business smarter
item.description: Midday provides you with greater insight into your business and automates the boring tasks, allowing you to focus on what you love to do instead.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: PySheets
item.description: PySheets provides a spreadsheet UI for Python, allowing users to perform exploratory data science, use Pandas, create charts with matplotlib, import Excel sheets, analyze data, and create reports. All the Python code runs in the browser, and PySheets itself is also written in Python. With PySheets, users can load any Python package and JS module to leverage the huge data-science ecosystem without needing to write much code.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: htmx deep dive w/carson gross
item.description: In this video we will do a deep dive on how htmx works internally, so you can debug issues you might come across.Table of Contents:02:45 - Tools Overview05:5...

item.description: Do calculations with your database in a neat and extremely fast way
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)

item.title: Variance
item.description: Build powerful data visualizations for the web. Without writing JavaScript. Variance empowers engineers, designers, journalists, scientists, and analysts to build elegant bespoke data graphics for the web, using only HTML & CSS. Our intuitive, markup-based grammar emphasizes clear, practical graphics and serves as the foundation for a wide range of visualizations.
item.author: eric@bookerics.com (Eric)
